reviewText: Fun to see all the old picture cards.  A few were a bit out of sorts for me, but 99% looked great.  Brought back memories of using my grandparents viewer when I was a kid.  If you could add some ambiance to it, maybe have a soft volume level old time music playing on the record player instead of just static.  Or maybe it is there and I missed how to turn it on.\n\nOverall well worth the price of free.

reviewText: A great VR museum experinece. This seems like one of the most useful things that VR can achive, a presence of time as well as place. I was surprise just how much time I spent in this seemingly simple demo. I love the concept, and the way that I'm taken to another place full realized with a unique focus.

reviewText: Excellent application of VR, especially for free!  Great as a quick VR demo for anyone interested in history.\n\nThe developer is still working on it, so it'll get better. I'd say the most needed feature would be sorting the photos into categories so someone interested in one type of picture doesn't need to click through 700 photos to find what they are looking for.

reviewText: This is actually one of the coolest VR demos I've yet seen. I line up my real chair in my room to the one in the scene and just relax and travel the world of over 100 years ago in stereo glory. Excellent work, dev. My only request is to be able to turn off the laser pointer in the room.

reviewText: A neat little app with some nice details. It's worth a quick look and some of the pictures really tell a story. Some can be a little headache-inducing due to the perspective forced by them, but overall a neat little experience to pad out your content
